Description:
Large Building Block Close to Train Station
Located close to the Clunes train station and backing onto the showgrounds this large allotment offers a tranquil location close to all the idyllic town of Clunes has to offer. Well known for Book Town Weekend and Hollywood movie sets, Clunes Township is just a short walk down the road.
Power, water and sewerage are connected ready to build your dream home on STCA. With only the neighbour's back yard between you and amazing views across the valley, secure this lovely block today!

Description:
Home for the horse lover on 20 acres
If it's space you're looking for then you can't go past this spacious 3 bedroom brick home. Perfectly located for private living while enjoying the open spaces of 20 acres and views of the surrounding countryside and only 5 mins drive to Clunes town centre. Property is divided into 7 electrified paddocks with bore water to all as well as 2 dams. Option to run toilet from bore or tank.
Features include:
Two metre timber veranda all around including sun blinds, new carpet to huge living area, wood heating, ceiling fans, walk-through robe and en-suite to extra large master bedroom. Timber kitchen with feature raked ceiling to dining area along with slate flooring. Plenty of space in the large garage semi lined with ceiling fan and ample space for a workshop. A four bay carport is attached. Sundry shedding, several horse boxes and a round yard. Mature shade trees and natives. Rear paddock has been sown with lucern. Terrific views of Mount Beckworth. All this and more. A must to inspect for the serious buyer.
Insights: 95 Beckworth Court Road, Clunes VIC 3370 was last sold in 2017 and 17 other 3 bedroom house in Clunes have recently been sold.

Description:
CHARMING HOME CLOSE TO TOWNSHIP
This charming 2 bedroom home has picture perfect street appeal complete with established rose garden.
Including:
*Sunroom to catch the morning sun
*Double glass doors are a feature to lounge room opening into separate formal dining
*Split system, wood & LPG gas heating
*Ample storage in large laundry with second toilet
*Activity room
*Reticulated easy care garden including fernry
*Garden shed & wood shed
*Lock up garage (powered) with carport
*Bitumen driveway to reart
*2x water tanks
*Walking distance to main shopping precinct

Description:
Highly recommended to wander and inspect
Just minutes from the town centre and positioned with local conveniences within walking distance, this tranquil home provides stunning gardens, views across the rolling hills and the delights of country life through each window. A wide full span verandah hosts a relaxing zone to take in the perfumes and colour of the pretty garden which is detailed with an attractive feature bridge and wishing well.
An open plan living with wood heating flows seamlessly through to the elongated kitchen which incorporates ample storage and cupboard space plus a sunny light meals area creating a light bright atrium effect, perfect to work and dine with family and friends.
Three bedrooms along with a tiled study plus a full family bathroom and generous laundry, ensure all rooms are serviced well and provide enough space to juggle the floorplan. Outside the garage benefits from an additional room/bungalow, which may provide an extra room for guests or storage. A peaceful undercover area along with a great entertaining zone provides an opportunity to show off this special garden setting. Definitely a delight for any garden lover just 20 minutes from Ballarat, this home is highly recommended to inspect.
Insights: 17 other 3 bedroom house in CLUNES have recently been sold.

Description:
Fabulous Family Home
With 1000m2, this well presented brick veneer home is positioned beautifully to take advantage of the land size. Located in the historic gold mining township of Clunes and in walking distance to Clunes primary school, this modern light filled home is perfect for a growing family. Four bedrooms, as well as a study nook, provide an ideal plan for a large family with the master incorporating a fabulous walk in robe and ensuite, which conveniently provides dual access to a further bathroom facility for extra convenience.
The open plan meals and living space is designed completely to incorporate the corner timber kitchen and benefits from a breakfast bar, walk in pantry and stainless steel appliances. This area has an inviting wood heater plus the convenience of a split system for complete temperature control. The entire home is light and airy and has large windows to take in the established garden and watch over the chickens in the back yard. Raised vegetable gardens, a charming cubby house and an ideal outdoor entertaining space is designed to shade the home yet capture the sunshine. A steel framed approx 4 x 6m workshop with concrete floor and power is also on site for all the tools and equipment. Services are connected including town water and sewerage.
Be sure to check out the prolific orchard to the rear where a variety of: fig, cherry, olive, apple, apricot, nectarines and lemons are surrounded by new fencing.
Situated North of Ballarat and 90 minutes from Melbourne, this town is blessed with history, heritage, environment and nature, a perfect place to raise a family.
Insights: 11 other 4 bedroom house in CLUNES have recently been sold.

Description:
One with the lot on Fairview
Inground salt water pool with solar heating set on approx 3 acres provides a resort style home with fabulous entertaining zones and room to move.
Recently refreshed with internal decorations this 3 bedroom residence provides loads of natural light and a charming presence.
Warmed with a solid fuel heater plus split system this home is temperature controlled throughout the seasons.
An open plan kitchen provides all the area and modern appliances required, with stainless steel oven and ample cabinetry. A relaxing dining and living room adjoin this space which allows easy interaction with the family.
All bedrooms are serviced adequately with a well appointed family bathroom and a decent size laundry, which is in constant use after swimming in the pool.
Outside, the home provides sufficient space to ride a bike or kick a football and the novelty of a solid chicken coup and fabulous dog run provide a real country feel.
Only minutes from town, this lovely country property is encircled with a colour bond fence and is individualised by an expansive veranda across the breadth of the home.
A quiet location only minutes from the popular destination of Clunes, where bushwalks, gold prospectors and treasure hunters seek a romantic getaway. Clunes also offers sumptuous food, wine and accommodation amidst the usual country town facilities.
Talk to the girls at our Creswick office and ensure this home is on your inspection list.
Insights: 17 other 3 bedroom house in CLUNES have recently been sold.

Description:
Well maintained 3 bedroom home on 1014m2 block
With the charm of the 1940s and just a short walk to the historic shopping precinct of Clunes, this tastefully renovated home is a must see. Offering three good sized bedrooms, polished timber floors, new kitchen & bathroom with spa plus second living area featuring wood fire heating. Lounge has gas heating and air conditioning. Enjoy outdoor entertaining under the Wisteria covered pergola. Under cover parking is taken care of with the large double carport including large single garage with workshop. Neat easy care garden with vegetable patch and a variety of fruit trees on a 1014m2 block. Inspection by appointment.

Large building block of 1012m2 in the heart of historic township

With views over the township and Mount Beckworth as the back drop this great parcel of land is walking distance to the primary school, swimming pool, football ground and bowling club. Just a short stroll to the historic town centre. Situated in a quiet location, is ideal for tranquil country living. Power, water and sewer connection all close by.

Description:
Approximately 185 acres of farming land less than 5 minutes from town centre
Comprising of approximately 170 acres freehold and 15 acres on 99 year lease. With 200 kilos of fertilizer per year, this property has been used for grazing and cropping of lucerne and rye grass.
Features:
6 bay hayshed
Water supplied by windmill plus dam
Power available
7 paddocks all troughed
Good sized shelter belt
Rear access & access points in all corners
Mt Beckworth views

Description:
For both - Giant shed plus renovation
Located in the heart of town, with the Clunes bowls club just across the way and a short stroll to the historic main street, this 847m2 allotment has the man and women in mind.
An enormous 6 x 14 shed with power and concrete is located perfectly for complete access clearance and internally the home has been renovated with quality tiles and plus carpet. Warmed by an open fire and split system this residence is well designed with a real contemporary country flow in the kitchen with stainless steel appliances, glass splashbacks and large enough to house the dining table centrally.
Four bedrooms have been painted in neutral tones with the master incorporating a convenient ensuite and built in robes.
Four old walnut trees grace this property, which give this home an individual significance along with the additional benefit of a 99year lease to the rear of the block to the DEPI.
A handy green house provides fresh food straight from the garden all year around and eight solar panels provide an eco friendly home with 2.5kw back providing 68c per kw back to the grid.
If you are serious about living in the country with real benefits and convenience, then this home is a must on your inspection list.
Insights: 11 other 4 bedroom house in CLUNES have recently been sold.

Description:
Great Country Home on 9.5 acres
This Western Red Cedar home is a great get away from city living. Set on approx330 9.5 acres consists of 2 large paddocks plus established house area. Features pine lined Cathedral ceilings, floating timber floors, veranda on 2 sides with large under cover decking to rear overlooking gardens with views to Mount Beckworth. Also included:
3 Bedrooms, plus air-conditioned Bungalow, ceiling fans, built-in robes
Split system/wood fire heating
Extensive gardens including mature shade trees, fruit trees & vegie patch
Double garage with carport plus machinery shed and garden shed
Excellent fencing, easy access to paddocks
Tennis Court
Circular drive
2 x Dams, 1with feature island
Walking distance to Health Service and approx 1km to centre of town.
A must to inspect for the serious buyer!

Description:
TAKE A LOOK AT THIS LIFESTYLE PROPERTY IN CLUNES
This hidden gem is tucked away in one of Clunes' most private locations & only minutes from the township. This site has 4 parcels - allot 1 Sec B, allot 2A Sec B, allot 2B Sec B & allot 12 Sec B. Situated on 72.82 hectares (179.95 acres) with picturesque dual creek frontages (both permanent) & volcanic soil, ideal for both stock & cropping. The elevated homestead offers a huge formal lounge with slow combustion heating & sensational views of the surrounding countryside, 3 large bedrooms with built in robes, large kitchen/dining area & recently updated bathroom. Outside includes 3 bay shed, 50x25 hay shed, cattle yards, 8 paddocks, dam, abundant water from Tullaroop & Birch creeks & an endless supply of magnificent drinking water from a bore. Inspection by appointment.
Insights: 295 Foleys Road, CLUNES VIC 3370 was last sold in 2014 and 17 other 3 bedroom house in CLUNES have recently been sold.

Description:
Hard to beat yet easy to transform
For those in the market for a three bedroom home plus a two bedroom bungalow previously used as a Bed and Breakfast, then this might be right for you.
Ideal entertainer with a large central living/dining room with light bay entry creates extra legroom when entering this appealing home. Your focus and vision takes you straight through double leadlight doors into an inviting country kitchen, custom made to surround a homely agar combustion oven. Complete with angled island bench, further electric cooking, ceiling fans and great walk in pantry, this is a spacious welcoming hub. With three good sized bedrooms, a huge master with mirrored built in robes and fresh ensuite, this home is very livable. A flowing sunroom/activity room is lined with glossy ceiling boards and is fully carpeted, a great spot to relax and soak up the sunshine during the winter months. With further wood heating, good storage, established gardens and plenty of car space, this is a fabulous home to add your personal touch.
If you enjoy fruit, then this property has a wonderful array, including: apple, pears, plums and apricots in a tucked away orchard. The bungalow offers two bedrooms and large rumpus connected to town sewer and water and surrounded by a stunning willow tree, hot house, wood/garden shed and a chook shed you could really introduce the country lifestyle to the accommodation market. With Mount Beckworth view as another advantage, this could be a real five star.
Be quick to snap up this opportunity, call for an inspection today.

Description:
What more could you start with?
Close to town with direct bitumen access and superbly situated in a quiet court, this great parcel of land boasts a small garden shed, a four bay shed including one bay lock up and prolific fruit trees, all creating a great introduction to a fabulous building site for the construction of your dream home. Planning permit for the building of a dwelling has already been approved, and a septic tank already installed. Whilst in the building process, there is, surprisingly, a caravan included in the price, a perfect asset to have on site when construction takes place. Fully fenced, this 1.53Ha, or almost 4 acres, has great views and the sounds of the winter creek in the background. This delightful parcel of land is definitely worth an inspection. Be sure to drive past and then call into or phone the Creswick office to allow the friendly staff to walk you through the process of purchasing this remarkable allotment.

Description:
Building Block with Best Views in Clunes!
Lot 5, Angus St Frontage.
Have you been searching for an elevated building block with fantastic views? Well here it is! Located only a few minutes walk from the township centre is this 2860m2 building lot.
This great parcel of land is zoned township or TZ in the planning scheme and has the best views over the historic township of Clunes , with Bitumen road frontage, power, town water and sewerage all available on completion of the subdivision. This picturesque block of land is virtually across the road from the Sporting ground , Clunes swimming pool and other sporting facilities and is also located just down the road from the Gorgeous Clunes Primary School, it's perfect for the construction of a family home!

Description:
Spacious Home of Grand Proportions on approx 18.8 ac
Immediately on entering this property a sense of style is created. An avenue of trees lines the drive on approaching this well maintained residence with huge wide verandas that surround the entire home. Positioned beautifully to view the rolling plains and set within an attractive garden, creates a sense of calm. With 50 squares under roof, this home presents as generous living. Four fabulous sized bedrooms, including; a luxury master with walk in robe large enough to use as a dressing room and a fresh light ensuite creating a luxurious space for the owners. Two generous living areas heated by a free standing log fire and cooled via a ducted system and split system ensures all members of the family are kept cool and warm throughout all seasons. A stunning country kitchen with stainless steel appliances and double pantry provides ample storage, ensuring a breeze for the family to keep the room free of clutter and enjoyable to work in. This huge space opens onto an everyday dining and family room, creating the heart of the home and allowing the chef to be involved in the family conversation. The family bathroom is centrally located and has a large corner spa to relax in after a day on the farm.
Approx 18.8 acres divided into six paddocks complete with spring fed dam, functional loading ramp and cattleyards with troughs, a double work shed or extra double garage, three bay machinery shed, chook shed and 4kw's of solar panels, this home truely paints the perfect picture for hobby farming in complete style. An unlimited bore is piped throughout the immaculate gardens, so staying green throughout the summer is no longer an issue! Located 5 mins from the glorious township of Clunes and 30 mins from the Busy CBD of Ballarat, this is truly a delight to see. Arrange an inspection as soon as possible, to gain a real feel for this glorious country estate.
Insights: 11 other 4 bedroom house in CLUNES have recently been sold.

Description:
Well presented 3 bedroom home on 1031m2
Read a book or just enjoy the sunshine while sitting under the veranda of this quality built, low maintenance home in Weathertex. Features include:
Large open plan living
3 Bedrooms, main with 2 way bathroom including spa bath & built-in robes
Quality pure wool carpet
Solar hot water
Fully insulated including internal walls
2 x Split system units
Walk in pantry, stainless steel appliances
Ducted vacuum
Low maintenance garden
Sun blinds
Fully fenced
6m x 9m Double garage with remote control roller doors
Walking distance to the Clunes Train Station and Health Service
